page.title: 01Mousehole and Lamorna
page.content: Mousehole and a part of Lamorna both lie in Paul Church Parish but the church is just in the block to the north. Both of these areas are on the coastline and are very picturesque and Lamorna has a beautiful wooded valley stretching in from the cove. The two main industries of the area are{tourism,}particularly in the coastal area, and{farming}inland. At one time Mousehole was a purely fishing village with quaint narrow streets of cottages. Today many of those cottages are used for holiday letting or in some instances for second homes, and most of the boats in the harbour are used for{recreational} pursuits which also includes some fishing. Throughout the area there are many artist studios, potteries and craft workshops which cater for the tourist.
